project-requirements.functionality: Create a Java libraries that wrap the jdm-api.demo.lirmm.fr with a cache layer using in-memory caching. Test will be run during the devellopment to ensure the cache is working as expected.

cache-implementation-specifications.performant: O(1) or O(log n) complexity for main operations
cache-implementation-specifications.minimal-public-api: public interface Cache<K, V> {V get(K key);void put(K key, V value);void invalidate(K key);void clear();CacheStats getStats();}

project-requirements.performance: The cache should improve response times by at least 50% for repeated requests.
project-requirements.caching-strategy: Implement 2 caching strategies: Least Recently Used (LRU) and Time-To-Live (TTL) based eviction policies.
project-requirements.scalability: The caching solution should handle up to 10,000 concurrent requests without significant performance degradation.
project-requirements.reliability: The cache should have a hit rate of at least 80% under typical usage patterns.
project-requirements.security: Ensure that sensitive data is not stored in the cache and implement appropriate access controls.
project-requirements.usability: The library should have a simple and intuitive API for developers to integrate the caching functionality.
project-requirements.maintainability: The code should be modular and well-documented to facilitate future enhancements and bug fixes.
project-requirements.testing: Comprehensive unit and integration tests should be provided to validate the caching functionality and performance improvements.
